item.title: The Conference Report of Why R? Turkey 2022: The First R Conference with Call For Papers in Turkey
item.dc:creator: Mustafa Cavus
Olgun Aydin
Ozan Evkaya
Derya Turfan
Filiz Karadag
Ozancan Ozdemir
Ugur Dar
Deniz Bezer
item.description: Why R? Turkey 2022 was a non-profit conference that aimed to bring Turkish R users together and encourage them to attend the R conferences. The targeted audience of the conference consisted of, data scientists, data analysts, and all R users from academia and industry. The three-day conference, which consisted of several events such as workshops, regular talks, lightning talks, short tutorials, and panels, was free of charge and fully online. This article describes the challenges and benefits, as well as providing an overview of the conference's content and participants’ profile.

item.title: R Medicine 2020: The Power of Going Virtual
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth J. Atkinson
Peter D. Higgins
Denise Esserman
Michael J. Kane
Steven J. Schwager
Joseph B. Rickert
Daniella Mark
Mara Alexeev
Stephan Kadauke
item.description: The third annual R/Medicine conference was planned as a physical event to be held in Philadelphia at the end of August 2020. However, a nationwide lockdown induced by the COVID-19 pandemic required a swift transition to a virtual conference. This article describes the challenges and benefits we encountered with this transition and provides an overview of the conference content.

item.title: Conference Report of Why R? Turkey 2021
item.dc:creator: Mustafa Cavus
Olgun Aydın
Ozan Evkaya
Ozancan Ozdemir
Deniz Bezer
Ugur Dar
item.description: The Why R? Turkey 2021 as a three-day online conference was organized to bring together researchers and professionals from Turkey on April 16-17-18, 2021. We hereby aimed to promote the R community in Turkey by bringing R users with different backgrounds such as genetics, sociology, finance, economy, bio-statistics. There were 8 thematic sessions and 18 invited speakers. In this article, it is aimed to describe the preparation phase, technical details, and the impact of the conference on audience.
